text: hello my name is James John and I'm a
senior product manager at AWS today I'm
going to give a brief overview of Amazon
ec2 p3 instances and how to get started
using them p3 instances are the most
powerful GPU instances in the cloud and
are ideal for parallel compute intensive
tasks in the areas of machine learning
and high-performance computing
customers like Toyota research have been
able to reduce their ml model training
times from days to hours enabling ml
engineers to iterate faster train more
models and increase accuracy in their
pursuit of building safer more
accessible mobility p3 comes in sizes
that include 1 4 or 8 nvidia tesla v 100
GPUs for up to one petaflop of compute
performance in a single instance at the
highest end P 3d and 24x large is for
customers that need the most GPU memory
CPUs and networking bandwidth in a
single instance these are also ideal for
large-scale distributed processing as
multiple nodes can be clustered together
and leverage the 100 gigabits of
networking throughput and the AWS custom
elastic fabric adapter for low latency
internode communication now that you
know what p3 is used for and it specs
how do you get started you have a choice
of different ways to launch a p3
instance an easy way to start using p3
is with the Amazon deep learning Ami's
or deep learning containers that are
pre-configured development environments
with the latest ML frameworks Nvidia
CUDA toolkits and a jupiter notebook
containing tutorials to get started p3
also provides a powerful option for ML
training as part of Amazon sage maker
which is our fully managed service that
covers the entire ml workflow from data
preparation algorithm development model
training and deployment there is also
full support for Amazon Elastic
kubernetes service an elastic container
service to make it easy to deploy manage
and scale containerized applications in
summary p3 instances can help
dramatically improve processing times
for machine learning and HPC workloads
and allow you to focus on bringing
innovative products to market faster if
you'd like to learn more please visit
our website
